cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 mi south-southeast of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast with a slow turn north-northwest, expected to come ashore between Corpus Christi and Port O’Connor then drift inland toward the upper Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass; Storm Surge Watch from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island, extending into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible at the port as early as Friday with a 49 % cumulative chance; hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out (1 %–2 %).
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC indicates 4–6 ft of surge possible for Port Mansfield to High Island, which includes Port Freeport.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches possible with locally higher amounts, producing life-threatening flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and potential for prolonged flooding because the system may stall near the coast.
